project.teaser: PrAEctiCe will provide a novel agro-ecology indicator set for East Africa, aimed at helping smallholder farmers in their agro-ecological transition. The project goes beyond the existing indicator frameworks by putting the “concept into action” with a decision support tool...
project.objective: PrAEctiCe will provide a novel agro-ecology indicator set for East Africa, aimed at helping smallholder farmers in their agro-ecological transition. The project goes beyond the existing indicator frameworks by putting the “concept into action” with a decision support tool for agro-ecology advisors supporting the selection of the best suited combination of agro-ecological practices in a local context. In addition, it puts a focus on circular water-energy-nutrient systems of integrated aqua-agriculture, an practice with high potential for efficient farming with minimal climate impacts, which has not been sufficiently explored in previous indicator work. Through a multi-stakeholder approach, new insight on agro-ecological practices in East Africa will be gathered to inform on existing successful practices as well as the barriers and drivers of East African smallholder farmers. This insight will help develop an indicator framework for agro-ecology, which, while building on existing frameworks, is adapted to the East African context and captures integrated aqua-agriculture practices in detail. The PrAEctiCe decision support tool will then, at the farm level, help assess environmental and socio-economic impacts, with a particular focus on impacts on climate change mitigation and adaptation as well as financial viability. The tool will be validated in three living labs, situated in Kenya, Uganda and Tanzania, covering different integrated aqua-agriculture farming set-ups. Knowledge sharing activities through trainings, student exchanges and events, ensure the dissemination of results across East Africa and between AU and EU. To reach practitioners at every level, a cascade training mechanism with a train-the-trainer course will help agro-ecology advisors train farming representatives at the local level who then will help the farmers in their agro-ecological transition. Policy recommendations for AU and EU policies will round off the project.
project.title: Potentials of Agroecological practices in east Africa with a focus on Circular water-energy-nutrient systems
project.keywords: agro-ecological farming practices, integrated aqua-agriculture, East Africa, impact assessment, decision support tool, multi-stakeholder engagement, climate change, circularity

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 2 - PrAEctiCe (Potentials of Agroecological practices in east Africa with a focus on Circular water-energy-nutrient systems)
result.teaser: East Africa, like many other regions in Africa, is experiencing food insecurity due to prolonged droughts, soil erosion, and changes in rainfall seasons caused by climate change and extreme weather conditions. The Covid-19 pandemic and ongoing global disputes further...

webItem.alternativeText: PrAEctiCe project consortium meeting in Entebbe, Uganda. September 2023.

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Report on co-creation workshops with stakeholders
result.description: This report will summarize the outcomes from the co-creation workshops: inputs from key stakeholders on the state of AE in East Africa, the barriers and drivers for AE transition and relevant indicators for measuring the impacts of AE practices

result.title: Report on project website, corporate identity and communication toolkit
result.description: Report on project website, corporate identity (project logo, templates for deliverables, powerpoint presentations) and communication toolkit (set-up of project social media channels (LinkedIn, Twitter and YouTube), roll-up, posters, flyers, design of newsletters

result.title: Report on user experiences for designing the decision support tool
result.description: "This report will summarise the outcomes from the ""user experience"" workshops."

result.title: PrAEctiCe Data Collection Methodology
result.description: Report laying out the data collection methodology.

result.title: Precision mapping of Agro-Ecology practices in East Africa
result.description: Report on the results of the mapping of agro-ecological practices in various AE zones of East Africa, diverse AE practices relevant for smallholder farming with a particular focus on identifying emerging innovations that are enabling production of aquaculture and other foods while applying AE principles.

result.title: Practice abstracts - Batch 1
result.description: This deliverable contains 10 practice abstracts at the EIP-AGRI format.

result.title: Report on agro-ecological indicators to cover integrated aquaculture food production systems in East Africa
result.description: This report will present the results of the gap analysis on the current coverage of integrated aqua-agriculture practices in East Africa. This analysis will allow the expansion and/or the adaptation of indicators in the current frameworks.

result.title: Analysis of success factors of selected case studies
result.description: The selected agroecological case studies from T2.3 will be analysed in detail to extract underlying success factors and those success factors will be analysed in this report.

result.title: Report on set-up and commissioning of the living labs
result.description: Report on the set-up and commissioning of the living labs. Each living labs will be described providing information on their innovative energy efficient systems, their innovative nutrient efficient systems and their innovative water efficient systems.

result.title: Selection of successful case studies of combinations of agro-ecological practices
result.description: This report will present 10 best practice examples across various climatic zones in East Africa. A particular focus will be put on examples with positive climate impacts and high financial viability for the farms within the priority countries Kenya, Uganda and Tanzania.

result.title: Review of ethical principles and relevant legislations
result.description: Review of ethical principles and relevant legislations (EU & AU) to be applied to PrAEctiCe activities

result.title: A synthesis of agroecology indicator frameworks and application for East Africa

details.authors: Erick Ogello, Harun Ogindo, Nicholas Outa, Mavindu Muthoka, David Pokupec, Andreja Borec, Benjamin Ombok, Fredrick Aila, Nicholas Kiggundu, Jesca Nakavuma, Ellen Kayendeke, Charles Tumuhe, Daniela Ríos Rodríguez, Jan Hoinkis

result.title: Stakeholder map for Agro-Ecology in East Africa
result.description: A mapping of relevant stakeholders involved in agro-ecology (AE), existing networks and programmes in the nexus of AE, environment and business will be identified in East Africa. The mapping includes the coding of organisations’ location and their AE work and the identification of capacity needs for different stakeholders.

result.title: Optimizing Black Soldier Fly (Hermetia illucens) production: effects of substrate variation on biomass, nutritional quality, hatchability, fecundity, and frass quality

details.authors: Erick O. Ogello, Nicholas O. Outa, Mavindu Muthoka, Fredrick Juma, Jan Hoinkis

result.title: Agroecology principles in aquaculture: a case study of East Africa

details.authors: David POKUPEC, Tina LEŠNIK, Andreja BOREC

result.title: Mapping of integrated aqua-agriculture in East Africa
result.description: This report will provide an overview of current integrated aqua-agriculture (IAA) sites in East Africa. This overview will be performed by internet research and inputs from consortium partners.

result.title: Report on existing indicator frameworks
result.description: This report will review existing indicator frameworks for evaluating economic and environmental sustainability of agro-ecological practices in East Africa. This review will be performed by through literature search.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
